Arméfördelningen'''}}), also known as the '''Northern Army Division''' and the '''6th Army Division''', was a [[Division (military)|division]] of the [[Swedish army]] that existed from 1893 to 1978. The division headquarters where first located in [[Härnösand]], [[Ångermanland]] and later in [[Östersund]], [[Jämtland]]. == Name and designation == {| class="wikitable" width=60% | |- ! Designation || Name || Translation || From || To |- | ||6. arméfördelningen || 6th Army Division || 1893 || 1901 |- | ||VI. arméfördelningen || VI Army Division || 1893 || 1901 |- | VI.förd|| Norra arméfördelningen || (VI) Northern Army Division || 1927 || 1937 |- | II.förd || II. arméfördelningen || II Army Division || 1937 || 1966 |- | 2.förd || 2. arméfördelningen || 2nd Army Division || 1966 || 1978 |} == References == *{{cite book |last=Braunstein |first=Christian |title=Sveriges arméförband under 1900-talet |year=2003 |publisher=Statens Försvarshistoriska Museer |location=Stockholm |isbn=91-971584-4-5}} {{Sweden-mil-stub}} [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1893]] [[Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1978]] [[Category:Divisions of Sweden]]

{{primary sources|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox organization | name = Banks Association of Turkey | native_name = Türkiye Bankalar Birliği | native_name_lang = tr | logo = | logo_size = | abbreviation = TBB | formation = {{start date and age|1958}} | type = Professional association | headquarters = [[Istanbul]] | membership = [[Institute of International Finance]]
[[European Banking Federation]]
Asian Bankers Federation | key_people = [[Naim Talu]] | website = {{URL|www.tbb.org.tr}} }} The '''Banks Association of Turkey''' (sometimes referred as, the ''Turkish Banks Association'') or '''''Türkiye Bankalar Birliği''''' (TBB) is an organisation for banks in Turkey. Membership is compulsory for commercial and investment banks operating in Turkey.TBB, [http://www.tbb.org.tr/en/about-the-association/the-association/11 The Association] Its activities include conducting policy-related research and collecting statistics. As of April 2016, it has 47 members. TBB has a General Assembly, which consist of representatives from member banks. General Assembly elects Board of Directors proportional to banks' year-end total assets. 8 members are elected by top 10 commercial banks, 3 members are elected by following 8 banks, 1 member elected by others and 1 member elected by investment banks. Participation banks, which operate as [[Islamic banking]], are not obliged to be a TBB member, but obliged to join a similar association, ''The [[Participation Banks Association of Turkey]]''. ==References== ==External links== * [http://www.tbb.org.tr/en/home Turkish Banks Association] [[Category:Bankers associations]] [[Category:1958 establishments in Turkey]] [[Category:Banking in Turkey]] {{Turkey-stub}}

{{Multiple issues|{{refimprove|date=May 2018}}{{more footnotes|date=May 2018}}}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Beikthano | settlement_type =City | image_skyline = | image_map = | map_caption =Beikthano – Pyu Ancient City | pushpin_map = Burma | pushpin_label_position = bottom | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Burma | coordinates = {{coord|20|0|14|N|95|22|46|E|region:MM|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|Burma}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Administrative divisions of Burma|Region]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Magway Region]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Districts of Burma|District]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Magway District]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Townships of Burma|Township]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Taungdwingyi Township|Beikthano]] | area_total_km2 = | elevation_m = | elevation_ft = | population = | population_as_of = | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone = [[Time in Burma|MST]] | utc_offset = +6.30 | website = }} '''Beikthano''' ({{lang-my|ဗိဿနိုး}}, {{IPA-my|beɪʔθənó|}}, also known as '''Panhtwa city''') situated in the irrigated [[Magway Region]], near present-day [[Taungdwingyi]]. In the era of the [[Pyu city-states]] it was a city of considerable significance, possibly a local capital replacing [[Sri Ksetra]]. Today the modest village is noted for its hot springs and archaeological sites. Beikthano, [[Hanlin, Burma|Hanlin]], and [[Sri Ksetra]], the ancient cities of the Pyu Kingdom were built on the irrigated fields of the dry zone of the Ayeyawady River basin. They were inscribed by [[UNESCO]] on its [[List of World Heritage Sites in Southeast Asia]] in May 2014 for their archaeological heritage traced back more than 1,000 years to between 200 BC and 900 AD.
Beikthano with direct land access to the well-watered [[Kyaukse]] plains to its northeast, is the oldest urban site so far discovered and scientifically excavated site. Its remains—the structures, pottery, artefacts, and human skeletons—date from 200 BCE to 100 CE. Named after the Hindu god [[Vishnu]], the city may be the first capital of a culturally and perhaps even politically uniform state in the history of Burma. It was a large fortified settlement, measuring approximately 300 hectares inside the rectangular (3 km by 1 km) walls. The walls and fortifications along it measured six meters thick, and are radiocarbon dated to a period between 180 BCE and 610 CE. Like most subsequent cities, the main entrance of the walls led to the palace, which faced east. Stupas and monastic buildings have also been excavated within the city walls.
[[File:Pyu sites.png|right|upright=0.6|thumb|Map of the most important [[Pyu city-states]]]]
==History== Beikthano is traditionally believed to have been founded some 2,400 years ago by Princess [[Pan Htwar]] descended from a still legendary dynasty of Tagaung in [[Upper Myanmar]]. The fall of the city is attributed to a mightier king, Duttabaung of Sri Ksetra, who sacked the city, subdued the princess, took her captive and eventually married her. In the present stage of historical research in this country the personalities characterized in the legend are beyond authentic identification. However, the existence of an ancient city called Beikthano (Vishnu City) is testified by the ruins which stand to this day and indicates that the legend may have sprung up from a nucleus of true facts.<ref name="a">{{cite web|url=https://www.gomyanmartours.com/beikthano/|title=Historical Sites in Myanmar / Beikthano|work=Go Myanmar Tours|date=|accessdate=15 May 2018|language=en}}</ref><ref name="b">{{cite web|url=http://myanmartravelinformation.com/2012-03-20-05-40-54/myanmar-lost-cities/41-about-myanmar/myanmar-lost-cities/115-beikthano-vishnu.html|title=An Ancient Center of the Pyu People of Myanmar|work=Myanmar Travel Information|date=|accessdate=15 May 2018|language=}}</ref>
==UNESCO inscription== In October 1996, Beikthano, [[Hanlin, Burma|Hanlin]] and [[Sri Ksetra]] were proposed to be inscribed on the [[UNESCO World Heritage List]]. This proposal was approved by [[UNESCO]] in the 38th session of the World Heritage Committee held in May 2014 in Doha, Qatar.<ref name=City>{{Cite web|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/89711/myanmars-3-ancient-cities-now-on-unesco-world-heritage-list|title=Myanmar's 3 ancient cities now on UNESCO World Heritage list|date=23 June 2014|accessdate=15 May 2018|publisher=Philippines News Agency, Xinhua}}</ref><ref name=Khinbe>{{Cite web|url=http://www.myanmargeneva.org/pressrelease/20140624%20three%20cities%20in%20unesco%20list.pdf|format=pdf|last=Khinbe|first=Aung|title=UNESCO: Myanmar’s first site inscribed to World Heritage List |accessdate=15 May 2018|publisher=The New Light of Myanmar}}</ref> According to the UNESCO report, the Pyu Kingdom prospered for over 1,000 years between 200 BC and 900 AD. All three sites are inscribed under Criterion (ii), (iii), and (iv) covering an area of {{Convert|5809| ha}} with a buffer zone of {{Convert|6790| ha}}. The integrity assessment by UNESCO of the three sites is: "The completeness and reliability of dated archaeological sequences from the site, with the radiocarbon dates derived from intact architectural features dating back to 190 BCE, provide scientific proof of the entire one-thousand year period of occupation of the cities, and reinforces [[Palaeography|palaeographic]] dates provided by inscriptions in Pyu script on artifacts excavated at the site"<ref name=Pyu>{{Cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1444|title=Pyu Ancient Cities|accessdate=15 May 2018|publisher=UNESCO Organization}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
* {{cite book | last=Aung-Thwin | first=Michael | title=Myanmar Land of the Spirits | chapter=Kingdom of Bagan | publisher=Co & Bear Productions | location=Guernsey | year=1996 | isbn=0-9527665-0-7 | editor=Gillian Cribbs}}

revision.text:
A '''Border Security Zone''' in [[Russia]] is the designation of a [[Border zone|strip of land]] (usually, though not always, along a Russian external border) where economic activity and access are restricted in line with the Frontier Regime Regulations set by the [[Federal Security Service]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://pravo.gov.ru/proxy/ips/?docbody=&nd=102451178|title=Приказ Федеральной службы безопасности Российской Федерации от 07.08.2017 № 454 "Об утверждении Правил пограничного режима"|last=|first=|date=|website=pravo.gov.ru|publisher=Официальный интернет-портал правовой информации|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-03-14}}</ref> For foreign tourists to visit the zone a permit issued by the local FSB department is required.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://og47.ru/2017/12/14/V-pogranzone---novye-pravila-1495|title=В погранзоне - новые правила - Общая газета Ленинградской области|access-date=2018-03-19|language=ru}}</ref>
The restricted access zone (of {{convert|7.5|km}} width generally, but e.g., running as much as {{convert|90|km}} deep along the [[Estonia]]n border) was established in the [[Soviet Union]] in 1934, and later expanded, at times including vast territories.{{Citation needed|date=July 2007}} In 1935–1936, in order to secure the western border of the Soviet Union, many nationalities considered unreliable ([[Poles]], [[Germans]], [[Ingrian Finns]], [[Estonians]], [[Latvians]]) were [[population transfer in the Soviet Union|forcibly transferred]] from the zone by forces of [[NKVD]].<ref name="martin">{{en icon}}{{Cite journal |last=Martin |first=Terry |date=December 1998 |title=The Origins of Soviet Ethnic Cleansing |journal=[[The Journal of Modern History]] |volume=70 |issue=4 |language=en |pages=813–861 |doi=10.1086/235168 |jstor=10.1086/235168 |url=https://dash.harvard.edu/bitstream/handle/1/3229636/Martin%201998.pdf?sequence=2}}</ref>
After the [[dissolution of the Soviet Union]] in 1991, the borders of the new Russian Federation were dramatically different, but the zone was not corrected accordingly and hence effectively ceased to exist. In 1993, the Law on the State Border was adopted and reestablished a border strip with restricted access, which should not exceed {{convert|5|km}} (although in fact it became much wider in some places).<ref name="lo"/> In 2004 the law was amended, the 5 km restriction was removed, and the FSB was legally authorized to draw the zone's limits on its own without coordination with local authorities.<ref name="lo">{{ru icon}} {{lang|ru|[http://www.around.spb.ru/guide/steelcurtain/steelcurtain.php Пограничная зона и пограничный режим на территории Ленинградской области и Республики Карелия]}}. 2006.</ref><ref name="fz">{{ru icon}} {{lang|ru|Федеральный закон от 01 апреля 1993 г. N 4730-1 в редакции от 7.03.2005 "[http://www.tamognia.ru/laws/law_1195.html О Государственной границе Российской Федерации]", Статья 16}}.</ref> In 2006 FSB Director [[Nikolay Patrushev]] and his deputy Sergei Smirnov issued decrees delimiting the zone, which expanded greatly and included many large settlements, important transport routes and resort areas, especially in the [[Republic of Karelia]], [[Leningrad Oblast]], and [[Primorsky Krai]].<ref name="lo"/><ref name="karelia">{{ru icon}} {{lang|ru|[http://www.regnum.ru/news/838160.html Погранзона в Карелии сокращена почти втрое]}}, 4 June 2007.</ref><ref name="primor">{{ru icon}} {{lang|ru|[http://www.regnum.ru/news/fd-fareast/primorie/835484.html В Приморье окончательно определены пограничные зоны] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930215948/http://www.regnum.ru/news/fd-fareast/primorie/835484.html |date=September 30, 2007 }}}}, 30 May 2007.</ref> In 2007, pressured by the public, FSB curtailed the zone in some places.<ref name="karelia"/><ref name="primor"/>
== See also == * [[Border Guard Service of Russia]] * [[Soviet Border Troops]] * [[Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://chekist.ru/article/1292 News from Border Security Zone of Russia (Russian)] *[http://pravo.gov.ru/search/index.html?action=search&advanced=true&searchPage=1&query=%D0%BF%D0%BE%D0%B3%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B9+%D0%B7%D0%BE%D0%BD%D1%8B&search=%D0%9D%D0%B0%D0%B9%D1%82%D0%B8&plugin=1001&search.root=%2F Official publications of Border Security Zones limits across the subjects of Russian Federation]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Border Security Zone Of Russia}} [[Category:Borders of Russia]] [[Category:Foreign relations of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Military of Russia]] [[Category:Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation]]
{{russia-stub}}

[[File:Carta Pisana.png|400px|thumb|A picture of the Carta Pisana.]]
The '''''Carta Pisana''''' is a map probably made at the end of the 13th century, about 1275-1300. New research suggests that it was made a century later.<ref>See: Pujades i Bataller, Ramon Josep, (2013), [http://www.lecfc.fr/new/articles/216-article-3.pdf ''The Pisana Chart. Really a primitive portolan chart made in the 13th Century?''], [http://www.lecfc.fr/ ''Comite Francais de Cartographie''], No. 216 (Juin 2013), pp. 17-32.</ref> It was found in [[Pisa]], hence its name. It shows the whole [[Mediterranean]], the [[Black Sea]] and a part of the [[Atlantic Ocean|atlantic]] coast, from the north of present-day [[Morocco]] (down to roughly the [[33rd parallel north]], with the town of [[Azemmour]]<ref name="Harley">{{cite book|title=History of Cartography|editor1=Harley, John Brian |editor2=Woodward, David |publisher=University of Chicago Press|location=Chicago, London|year=1987|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=uJaP4i7-_MIC&pg=PA404&dq=%22carte+pisane%22&as_brr=3&ei=une9S_ZZhL42nr3IzQc&cd=1#v=onepage&q=%22carte%20pisane%22&f=false}}</ref>) to the present-day [[Netherlands]], but the accuracy of the map is mostly limited to the Mediterranean.<ref name="Foundations">{{cite book|last=Diffie|first=Bailey Wallys|author2=Winius, George Davison|title=Foundations of the Portuguese empire, 1415-1580|publisher=University of Minnesota|location=Minneapolis|year=1977|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vtZtMBLJ7GgC&pg=PA129&dq=%22carta+pisana%22&as_brr=3&ei=GRW9S4LANKHWNI-6lNoK&cd=4#v=onepage&q=%22carta%20pisana%22&f=false}}</ref> It is the oldest surviving [[nautical chart]] (that is, not simply a map but a document showing accurate navigational directions).<ref name="Foundations" /><ref name="Riddle">{{cite book|last=Aczel|first=Amir D.|title=The riddle of the compass: the invention that changed the world|publisher=Harcourt Books|location=Orlando|year=2001|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tFcNHc6lu24C&pg=PA125&dq=%22carta+pisana%22&as_brr=3&ei=GRW9S4LANKHWNI-6lNoK&cd=1#v=onepage&q=%22carta%20pisana%22&f=false}}</ref> It is a [[portolan chart]],<ref name="Riddle" /> showing a detailed survey of the coasts, and many ports, but bears no indication on the [[topography]] or [[toponymy]] of the [[wikt:inland|inland]].<ref name="Geografia">{{cite book|last=Brancaccio|first=Giovanni|title=Geografia, cartografia e storia del Mezzogiorno|publisher=Guida editori Napoli|location=Napoli|year=1991|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=FxIn0_nDhiIC&pg=PA95&dq=%22carta+pisana%22&as_brr=3&ei=GRW9S4LANKHWNI-6lNoK&cd=3#v=onepage&q=%22carta%20pisana%22&f=false}}</ref> On the map, North is on the top, in contrast to other maps of the same period such as the [[Hereford Mappa Mundi]] (ca. 1300), where East is on the top.
== Origin and content == Possible places of origin for the map include [[Pisa]],<ref name="Riddle" /> where it was found, [[Venetia (region)|Venetia]], and [[Genoa]],<ref name="Geografia" /> which is the conventionally recognised place of origin.<ref name="Harley" /> The density of the ports referenced on the map is the highest for the coast of the [[Tyrrhenian Sea]], and the lowest for that of the [[Ionian Sea]]. This is possible evidence that the map is of [[Genoa|genoese]] origin, since [[Genoa]], at this time, was a major power in the [[Tyrrhenian Sea]].<ref name="Geografia" /> Additionally, the first textual reference to the use of such a detailed maritime chart, in 1270, is in relation to a Genoese ship.<ref name="Harley" />
The inaccuracy of the Atlantic part of the ''Carta Pisana'', especially when compared to its Mediterranean part, can be exemplified by its depiction of [[Great Britain]]: an irregular, rectangular shape, lying on an east–west axis. Only six place names are indicated for Great Britain. ''Civitate Londra'' ([[London]]) is placed in the middle of the southern coast.<ref name="Harley" />
As to the date of the map, it is partly indicated by the mention of the town of [[Manfredonia]], which was founded by king [[Manfred of Sicily]] in 1256.<ref name="Geografia" />
The sources used in the making of the ''Carta Pisana'' are difficult to determine. The use of several dialects in the place-names indicated on the map would tend to suggest that several regional sources were compiled to make the map. Other possibilities include a hypothetical earlier, no longer extant portolan chart, or [[Ancient Rome|Ancient Roman]] cartography. However, there is absolutely no evidence supporting the existence of an earlier portolan chart, and the fact that the map's most glaring error concerns Italy would undermine the theory of an Ancient Roman influence.<ref name="Harley" />
== Navigational aspects and relation to the compass ==
The map encompasses almost all of the [[Mediterranean]] inside two circles, one for the western Mediterranean, one for the eastern. These circles are divided into sixteen parts, providing the map with sixteen corresponding [[wind direction]]s. Furthermore, it comprises a two-directional [[scale (map)|scale]] subdivised into several segments corresponding to 200, 50, 10, and 5 miles.<ref name="Riddle" /> The exact value of these "portolan miles" is difficult to calculate in present-day units, given discrepancies between geographical areas on this map and others; but it is conventionally accepted to be around 1.25 kilometers.<ref name="Harley" />
== See also == *[[Table of Historical Maps]]
== References == <references/>
[[Category:Historic maps of the world]]

109 [[Reykjavík]] | ideology = {{ubl|[[Direct democracy]]|[[E-democracy]]}} | international = ''none'' | european = ''none'' | seats = {{Composition bar|0|63|hex=}} | website = | footnotes = }} The '''Democracy Movement''' ({{lang-is|Lýðræðishreyfingin}}) was an [[Iceland|Icelandic]] [[political movement]] that was established in 1998. In the [[Icelandic parliamentary election, 2009|2009 Icelandic parliamentary election]] it received 0.6% of the vote and is thus the second largest party not in parliament. == Election results == {| class="wikitable" ! width="100px" | Election ! width="70px" | Votes ! width="50px" | Vote % ! width="50px" | Seats ! width="50px" | Place |- ! [[Icelandic parliamentary election, 2009|2009]] | 1,107 {{Steady}} | 0.6 {{Steady}} | {{Composition bar|0|63|hex=}} | 7th {{Steady}} |} == Post-mortem == The party has ceased to exist after the 2009 election. On 29 January 2013, spurred by the ruling made by the [[EFTA Surveillance Authority v Iceland|EFTA court]] in the [[Icesave dispute]], the founder of the party helped to start a petition calling for the [[Member of Parliament|MP]]s previously having supported the ''Icesave bills'', now to withdraw from the parliament. At the bottom of the petition a note stated it had been powered by the domain of ''Democracy Movement''. The party however no longer exist as a party, as they no longer gather to yearly congress meetings - and also stopped running the website of the party.{{cite web|url=http://www.mbl.is/frettir/innlent/2013/01/29/vilja_ad_thingmenn_segi_af_ser/|title=Want MPs to resign|language=Icelandic|publisher=Mbl.is|date=29 January 2013|accessdate=14 February 2013}} == See also == * [[Politics of Iceland]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Parties of Iceland}} [[Category:1998 establishments in Iceland]] [[Category:2009 disestablishments in Iceland]] [[Category:Defunct political parties in Iceland]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1998]] {{Iceland-stub}}

revision.text:
The '''Garda Mounted Support Unit''' ({{lang-ga|Marcaonad an Gharda Síochaná}}) is the [[Mounted Police|horseback mounted division]] of the [[Garda Síochána]].
It is part of the Operational Support Unit which provides specialist support to Gardaí nationwide. The Operational Support Unit also includes the [[Garda Water Unit|Water Support]], [[Garda Dog Unit|Dog Support]] and [[Garda Air Support Unit|Air Support]] units.
==History and Formation== Historically, the predecessor to the Garda Mounted unit was the Dublin Horse Police which was part of the [[Dublin Metropolitan Police]]. This was disbanded in 1913 due to a lack of suitable horses for military requirements in Britain. The Garda Mounted Unit was formed in 1998 when the [[North Yorkshire Police]] disbanded its mounted unit allowing the Gardaí to acquire its horses and equipment. It became operational on 17 May that year.<ref>[http://www.ipaireland.com/IPA%20Journal%20Feb%2008/Fingal%20Feb%2008.pdf International Police Association ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110713052615/http://www.ipaireland.com/IPA%20Journal%20Feb%2008/Fingal%20Feb%2008.pdf |date=July 13, 2011 }}</ref>
==Current Operation== The unit has its base in the [[Phoenix Park]] with stables at [[Áras an Uachtaráin]] and not at the Garda Headquarters. The Unit has a strength of Two Sergeants and Sixteen Gardaí with fourteen horses with plans for expansion to fifteen horses. The [[Irish Draught]] Horse is the preferred breed for the Mounted Unit.<ref>[http://www.irishdraught.ie/index.php/garda/RID-Geldings-and-the-Garda.html Irish Draught Horse Association ]</ref><ref>[http://www.oireachtas-debates.gov.ie/D/0665/D.0665.200810230104.html Oireachtass reports] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609200548/http://www.oireachtas-debates.gov.ie/D/0665/D.0665.200810230104.html |date=2011-06-09 }}</ref>
==Functions== The Units general duties are high visibility crime prevention and include:- *Community Policing. *Event Policing. *Support to mainstream Garda operations. *Crowd Control & Public Order. *Searches for Missing Persons in inaccessible Areas.
==Operations== The Garda Mounted Unit typically attends at large public gatherings such as sporting occasions and concerts as well as other events such as the [[Ballinasloe Horse Fair]], the [[Dublin Horse Show]] at the [[Royal Dublin Society|RDS]] and [[National Ploughing Championships]]. It also attends the Dublin [[St Patricks Day]] parade and other State Occasions on a ceremonial basis. The Mounted Unit also attended the 2009 [[All-Ireland Hurling Final]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.garda.ie/controller.aspx?page=38 Garda Website]
{{Garda Síochána}}
[[Category:Garda Síochána units]]

{{Infobox anthem |title = ''Himno a la Montaña'' |english_title = Hymn to the Mountain |prefix = Regional |country = {{flag|Cantabria}}, [[Spain]] |composer = [[Juan Guerrero Urresti]] |author = [[Juan Guerrero Urresti]] |adopted = 1987 |until = |sound = |sound_title = Himno a La Montaña
}}
'''''Himno a la Montaña''''' ({{IPA-es|ˈimno a la monˈtaɲa}}, "Hymn to the Mountain"), or '''''Himno de Cantabria''''' ("Anthem of Cantabria"), is the official [[anthem]] of the [[Spain|Spanish]] [[autonomous communities in Spain|autonomous community]] of [[Cantabria]]. It was composed in 1926 by [[Juan Guerrero Urresti]] at the behest of the then [[Government of Cantabria|Provincial Council of Santander]] (''Diputación Provincial de Santander'') and subsequent arrangements by [[José del Río Sainz]], in the region's official anthem.<ref>''[http://www.parlamento-cantabria.es/UserFiles/Media/himno.ra Parlamento de Cantabria]'' (Parliament of Cantabria)</ref>
==Lyrics== {| border=0 |- | valign=top lang="es" style="font-family: Georgia, Palatino, Palatino Linotype, Times, Times New Roman, serif"| :'''''Himno de Cantabria'' ([[Spanish language|Spanish]])''' :''Cantabria querida'' :''te voy a cantar'' :''la canción que mi pecho'' :''te va a dedicar'' :''que es muy grande mi amor'' :''a la tierra en que nací.''
:''Quiero que sus sones'' :''puedan traspasar'' :''las montañas más altas'' :''y el inmenso mar,'' :''como ofrenda leal'' :''al terruño en que viví.''
:''Y es mi cántico amoroso'' :''cual arrullo maternal'' :''en que todos veneramos'' :''la Cantabria fraternal.''
:''Y un recuerdo cariñoso'' :''de pureza regional,'' :''a La Montaña dedico'' :''con vigor tradicional'' :''vigor tradicional'' :''vigor tradicional.''
:''Mi tierruca siempre ha de ser'' :''bella aurora del corazón'' :''y a ella un beso puro de amor'' :''y lleno de emoción'' :''siempre he de ofrecer.''
:''Hijos de mi Cantabria'' :''nobles de mi querer,'' :''hermanos montañeses'' :''por siempre hemos de ser.''
:''Juntos nos agrupemos'' :''muy fuerte y muy leal'' :''que la madre Cantabria'' :''un abrazo nos da.'' | valign="top" | :'''Hymn to the Mountain (English translation)''' :Dear Cantabria :I'll sing you :the song that my chest :will dedicate to you :since my love is so great :for the land where I was born.
:I want its sounds :to cross over :the highest mountains :and the great sea, :as loyal offering :to the homeland where I lived.
:And it is my loving song :like mother's lullaby :that we honor :brotherly Cantabria.
:And a fond remembrance :of this unspoiled land :to The Mountain I dedicate :with the strength of tradition :strength of tradition :strength of tradition.
:My homeland will always be :a beautiful glow in my heart :and a pure kiss of love :full of devotion :I have always to offer her.
:Sons of my Cantabria :my dear gentlemen :Brothers of The Mountain :we will be forever.
:We stand together :strong and loyal :as mother Cantabria :embraces us. |} <!--Correct translation?-->
==See also== * [[Anthems of the autonomous communities of Spain]]

{{Infobox film | name = Identity Pieces | image =IdentityPieces.JPG | image_size = | caption =Movie poster | director = [[Mwezé Ngangura]] | producer = Mwezé Ngangura | writer = Mwezé Ngangura | narrator = | starring = | music = [[Jean-Louis Daulne]]
[[Papa Wemba]] | cinematography = [[Jacques Besse]] | editing = [[France Duez]]
[[Ingrid Ralet]] | distributor = [[California Newsreel]] (USA) | released = {{film date|df=yes|1998|9|14|Canada|1999|1|15|USA|1999|5|19|Belgium|2000|7|26|France}} | runtime = 97 minutes | country = [[Belgium]]
[[France]]
[[Democratic Republic of the Congo]] | language = French
English
Dutch
Lingala
Kingwana
Kikongo
Tshiluba | budget = | gross = }} '''''Identity Pieces''''' ({{lang-fr|'''Pièces d'identités'''}}) is a [[1998 in film|1998]] [[Belgium|Belgian]]/[[France|French]]/[[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] [[comedy film]] written and directed by [[Mwezé Ngangura]]. It [[premiere]]d at the 1998 [[Toronto International Film Festival]]. ==Plot== Mani Kongo (Gérard Essomba) is the king of the [[Kongo people|Bakongo]]. His only daughter, Mwana, (Dominique Mesa) left for Belgium as a young child in hopes of becoming a doctor, but contact with her had been lost over the past few years. Mani Kongo decides to travel to Belgium in search of his beloved daughter. On arriving he will have to cope with the very best and the very worst of the black diaspora, as well as with prejudices rampant in European society. He himself will find good friends amongst poor low-class whites. ==Cast== * [[Gérard Essomba]] as Mani Kongo * [[Dominique Mesa]] as Mwana * [[Jean-Louis Daulne]] as Chaka-Jo * [[Herbert Flack]] as Jefke * [[David Steegen]] as Van Loo * [[Cecilia Kankonda]] as Safi * [[Thilombo Lubambu]] as Mayele * [[Mwanza Goutier]] as Viva-Wa-Viva (as Mouanza Goutier) * [[Nicola Donato]] as Jos ==Awards== ''Identity Pieces'' won several awards at the 1999 [[Panafrican Film and Television Festival]], including the grand prize. It also won the People's Choice Award at the [[Denver International Film Festival]]. ==External links== * {{IMDb title|0169128|Identity Pieces}} * {{Amg movie|173785|Identity Pieces}} {{use dmy dates|date=January 2011}} [[Category:1998 films]] [[Category:Belgian films]] [[Category:Democratic Republic of the Congo films]] [[Category:Films set in Belgium]] [[Category:Films shot in Belgium]] [[Category:Films set in the Democratic Republic of the Congo]] [[Category:Films shot in the Democratic Republic of the Congo]] [[Category:French films]] [[Category:French-language films]] [[Category:Wolof-language films]] [[Category:1990s comedy films]] [[Category:Films directed by Mwezé Ngangura]] {{belgium-film-stub}} {{DRCongo-film-stub}}

Lyricist: Heike Kospach | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Infobox song contest entry | song = {{Flag icon|Switzerland}} "Il pleut de l'or" | image = | caption = | year = 2010 | country = Switzerland | artist = [[Michael von der Heide]] | as = | with = | language = French | languages = | composer = [[Michael von der Heide]],
Pele Lorriano | lyricist = Heike Kospach | place = | points = | place_semi = 17th | points_semi = 2 | lyrics = | prev = The Highest Heights | prev_link = The Highest Heights | next = In Love for a While | next_link = In Love for a While }} }} "'''Il pleut de l'or'''" ({{IPA-fr|il plø də lɔʁ}}, ''It's Raining Gold'') is a song sung by [[Michael von der Heide]] and composed by the singer, Pele Lorriano and Heike Kospach. It represented Switzerland at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2010]] in [[Oslo]], [[Norway]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=7663&_t=Michael+von+der+Heide+to+represent+Switzerland|title=Michael von der Heide to represent Switzerland|last=Schacht|first=Andreas|date=18 December 2009|publisher=European Broadcasting Union|accessdate=18 December 2009}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=7088|title=Michael von der Heide goes to Oslo|last=Al Kaziri|first=Ghassan|publisher=''Oikotimes''|date=18 December 2009|accessdate=18 December 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100206031522/http://oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=7088|archivedate=6 February 2010|df=dmy-all}} It was first presented on 9 January 2010 at the ''SwissAwards'' show.{{Cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/14800|title=Switzerland: Michael von der Heide presents his song for Europe|last=Grillhofer|first=Florian|date=9 January 2010|publisher=''ESCToday''|accessdate=9 January 2010}} Michael von der Heide was backed in Oslo by singer Amanda Nikolić, former member of Swiss girlgroup Tears, Freda Goodlett and Sybille Fässler. [[English language|English]] and [[German language|German]] versions were released at a later stage.{{Cite web|url=http://swisscharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Michael+von+der+Heide&titel=Il+pleut+de+l'or&cat=s|title=CD-Information on swisscharts.com|last=Hung|first=Steffi|date=23 May 2010}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/15214|title=Michael von der Heide speaks to esctoday.com|last=Grillhofer|first= Florian|date=25 February 2010|publisher=''ESCToday''|accessdate=25 February 2010}} The German version, entitled ''Es regnet Gold'' was released on 12 April 2010.{{Cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/15508|title=MicSwitzerland: German version of Il pleut de l'or available|last=Grillhofer|first= Florian|date=12 April 2010|publisher=''ESCToday''|accessdate=12 April 2010}} ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (2010) !align="left"|Peak
position |- {{singlechart|Switzerland|65|artist=Michael von der Heide|song=Il pleut de l'or}} |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fz7IlMTq2wQ Official music video] - YouTube * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZO8cROQadck Performance at SwissAwards show] ''YouTube'' * [http://4lyrics.kwivia.co.uk/esc/2010/michael-von-der-heide-il-pleut-de-lor/ Lyrics]{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Eurovision Song Contest 2010}} {{Switzerland in the Eurovision Song Contest}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Il Pleut De L'or}} [[Category:Eurovision songs of 2010]] [[Category:Eurovision songs of Switzerland]] [[Category:2010 singles]] [[Category:2010 songs]] {{Switzerland-stub}}

Channel 822 (Other Cities) | cable serv 3 = [[TrueVisions]](Thailand) | cable chan 3 = Channel 245 (SD)
Channel 143 (HD) | cable serv 4 = [[Cablelink]](Philippines) | cable chan 4 = Channel 78 | cable serv 5 = [[Destiny Cable]](Philippines) | cable chan 5 = Channel 75 (Digital) | cable serv 6 = [[:zh:澳門有線電視|Macau Cable TV]] ([[Macau]]) | cable chan 6 = Channel 202 | cable serv 7 = [[Etisalat]] eLife ([[United Arab Emirates]]) | cable chan 7 = Channel 1066 (SD) | adsl serv 1 = [[Now TV (China)|Now TV]] (Hong Kong) | adsl chan 1 = Channel 156 | adsl serv 2 = [[Singtel TV]] (Singapore) | adsl chan 2 = Channel 376 (HD) | adsl serv 3 = [[Sri Lanka Telecom|Peo TV]] (Sri Lanka) | adsl chan 3 = Channel 87 |footnotes = }} '''KBS World''' is [[Korean Broadcasting System]]'s international broadcasting service. It consists of [[KBS World Radio]] and the [[KBS World (TV channel)|KBS World television channel]]. == History == The foreign-language radio broadcast from KBS (before its restructure into a public broadcaster in March 1973) was started as "The Voice of Free Korea" in 1953. It officially became a part of KBS in July 1968. The station was renamed Radio Korea in March 1973, and then Radio Korea International in August 1994. In July 2003, KBS World, an international television channel aimed at Koreans abroad, started broadcasting. In March 2005, Radio Korea International became KBS World Radio. Majority of the drama has their own subtitle depending on the country such as [[English language|English]], [[Chinese language|Chinese]], [[Malaysian language|Malaysian]], [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]], and [[Indonesian language|Indonesian]]. == Services == === Radio === {{Main|KBS World Radio}} KBS World Radio is South Korea's sole foreign language promotional broadcast for the entire world. Its programming features news, culture, music, entertainment, as well as Korean lessons. KBS World Radio currently broadcasts in [[Korean language|Korean]], [[English language|English]], [[Japanese language|Japanese]], [[French language|French]], [[Russian language|Russian]], [[Standard Chinese|Mandarin]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Indonesian language|Indonesian]], [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[German language|German]] and [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] and [[Cantonese]]. === Television === {{Main|KBS World (TV channel)}} {{Seealso|KBS World (Japan)|KBS America|KBS World (Indonesia)}} KBS World's TV programming is sourced from KBS's domestic television services. It mainly broadcast in Korean, but subtitles in English, Malay and Chinese are also provided. Apart from the signals from Seoul, there are three separate services operated by KBS's subsidiaries tailored to specific markets: the [[KBS World (Japan)|Japanese version of KBS World]], operated by KBS Japan, targets Japanese audiences, the [[KBS World (Indonesia)|Indonesian version of KBS World]], operated by OKTN, targets Indonesian audiences, while the [[KBS World (United States)|American version of KBS World]], operated by KBS America, targets audiences in both North and South America. [[File:KBS World.svg|thumb|200px|Former KBS World logo used from 2003 to 2009]] ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://world.kbs.co.kr KBS World] * [http://www.kbsworldi.com KBSWORLDi Service] {{DEFAULTSORT:Kbs World}} [[Category:Korean Broadcasting System subsidiaries]] [[Category:External services (broadcasting)]] [[Category:Television channels in South Korea]] [[Category:Korean-language television stations]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 2003]] {{bcast-stub}} {{SouthKorea-media-stub}}

{{Infobox military unit |unit_name=Khyber Border Coordination Center |image= |caption= |dates=March 29, 2008 to present |country=[[Afghanistan]], [[Pakistan]], [[International Security Assistance Force]] |type= [[Military intelligence]] |role= [[Joint warfare]] |size= |command_structure= |garrison= [[Torkham]], Afghanistan |garrison_label= |equipment= |equipment_label= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |colors_label= |march= |mascot= |battles= [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|War in Afghanistan]]
[[War in North-West Pakistan]] |anniversaries= |decorations= |battle_honours= |current_commander= |current_commander_label= |ceremonial_chief= |ceremonial_chief_label= |colonel_of_the_regiment= |colonel_of_the_regiment_label= |notable_commanders= |identification_symbol= |identification_symbol_label= |identification_symbol_2= |identification_symbol_2_label= }} The '''Khyber Border Coordination Center''' is a [[joint warfare|joint military]] [[military intelligence|intelligence]] center located near [[Torkham]], Afghanistan. The purpose of the facility is to facilitate the sharing of information between [[Afghanistan]], [[Pakistan]], the [[International Security Assistance Force]], and [[NATO]] government and military personnel in their war on [[Taliban]] forces in the [[Khyber Pass]] area. The center, managed primarily by the [[United States]] was officially opened on March 29, 2008 and became operational in July 2008. The center is the first of six scheduled to open along the Afghanistan-Pakistan border. ==References== *{{cite web | last = Rondeaux | first = Candace | date = January 12, 2009 | url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/01/11/AR2009011102236.html?wprss=rss_world | title = U.S.-Funded Intelligence Center Struggles In Khyber Region | format = Newspaper article | work = [[Washington Post]] | accessdate = January 14, 2009}} *{{cite web|last=United States Central Command |first= |date=April 1, 2008 |url=http://www.centcom.mil/en/press-releases/afghanistan-pakistan-open-khyber-border-coordination-center.html |title=Afghanistan, Pakistan open Khyber Border Coordination Center |format=Press release |work=[[United States Central Command]] |accessdate=January 14, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080920041103/http://www.centcom.mil/en/press-releases/afghanistan-pakistan-open-khyber-border-coordination-center.html |archivedate=September 20, 2008 }} {{coord missing|Afghanistan}} {{Pakistan Armed Forces}} [[Category:Military installations of Afghanistan]] [[Category:Military of Pakistan]] [[Category:Military units and formations of NATO]] [[Category:Military units and formations of the War in Afghanistan (2001–present)]] [[Category:Military units and formations of Pakistan]] [[Category:Military installations of the United States in Afghanistan]] {{mil-unit-stub}} {{Afghanistan-mil-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2015}} {{Infobox broadcasting network | name = KiRaKa | image = | logo = [[File:Kiraka logo1.png|300px]] | type = Children's | branding = | established = | test card = | test of transmission = | airdate = {{Start date|2006|9|4|df=yes}} | last airdate = | country = Germany | available = Cable TV, [[satellite]], [[DAB Radio]], [[Internet Radio|Internet]] | founded = | founder = | ceo = [[Tom Buhrow]] | slogan = | motto = Radio für schlaue Ohren!
(''Radio for smart ears'') | market_share = | license_area = | headquarters = [[Cologne]] | broadcast_area = Germany: [[Nordrhein-Westfalen]], [[Bremen]], [[Saarland]] (also nationwide via satellite).
Italy: [[Südtirol]]. | area = | erp = | owner = | parent = [[Westdeutscher Rundfunk|WDR]] | key_people = | foundation = | launch_date = | dissolved = | former_names = | digital = | analog = | servicename1 = | service1 = | servicename2 = | service2 = | servicename7 = | service7 = | callsigns = | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | affiliation = [[ARD (broadcaster)|ARD]] | affiliates = | groups = | former_affiliations = | webcast = | website = [http://www.kiraka.de www.kiraka.de] | footnotes = }} '''KiRaKa''' (pronounced /ˈkɪrɑkɑ/) – the name is an [[acronym]] formed from '''KI'''nder'''RA'''dio'''KA'''nal – is a digital radio channel produced by [[Westdeutscher Rundfunk]] (WDR) in [[Cologne]], [[Germany]]. It is a specialist channel serving children aged 5 to 16. Since 1 January 2016 KiRaKa has broadcast 24 hours a day via [[Cable television|cable]], [[satellite]], and [[Digital audio broadcasting|DAB]] in Germany, as well as worldwide on the Internet. Its programming at 19.05–20.00 daily as well as at 7.05–8.00 and 14.05–15.00 on Sundays is [[simulcast]] on [[WDR 5]].{{cite web|title=Stundenplan zum Ausdrucken 2016|url=http://www.kiraka.de/fileadmin/user_upload/KiRaKa-Stundenplan-zum-Ausdrucken-2016.pdf|website=www.kiraka.de|publisher=Westdeutscher Rundfunk|accessdate=1 January 2016}} A variety of children's programming is broadcast between 6.00 and 21.00 daily. Outside these hours KiRaKa plays music aimed at the 11-to-16 age group in a segment called ''Nachteule'' (Night Owls). ==Reception== Originally, KiRaKa was a single programme slot in WDR 5's daily schedule. However, on 29 May 2009 KiRaKa took over the distribution channels formerly used by [[WDR 2 Klassik]]. Today, the service is available across Germany via the [[Astra (satellite)|Astra]] satellite network, [[cable TV]] and [[Digital Audio Broadcasting|DAB]] radio. It is also available internationally via the Internet and WDR's radio applications for [[smartphone]]s and tablets.{{cite web|url=http://www.kiraka.de/info/b/wie-kann-ich-kiraka-hoeren/|title=Wie kann ich KiRaKa hören?|publisher=WDR KiRaKa|language=German|accessdate=16 November 2014}} ==Awards== In September 2014, KiRaKa and another of WDR's radio stations, [[Funkhaus Europa]], jointly won the award for Best Innovation at the 2014 German Radio Awards.{{cite web|url=http://www.radiowoche.de/deutscher-radiopreis-2014-die-gewinner/|title=Deutscher Radiopreis 2014 – Die Gewinner|last=Munder|first=Stephan|publisher=www.radiowoche.de|language=German|accessdate=15 November 2014}} The award was given to presenter-producers Tuba Tunçak and Mirjam von Jarzebowski for their collaboration on ''Kelebek im Konzert / Kelebek Konserde'' (Kelebek in Concert), a project aimed at introducing children to music from other cultures, starting at school level. It culminated in a live concert hosted by one German and one Turkish presenter, during which a variety of Eastern and Western music, as well as a fusion of the two, was played. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{Authority control}} {{coord missing|North Rhine-Westphalia}} {{Germany-stub}} {{Europe-radio-station-stub}} [[Category:Westdeutscher Rundfunk]] [[Category:Radio stations in Germany]] [[Category:Children's radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 2006]] [[Category:2006 establishments in Germany]] [[Category:Media in Cologne]]

The '''Lagos Plan of Action''' (officially the '''Lagos Plan of Action for the Economic Development of Africa, 1980–2000''') was an [[Organisation of African Unity]]-backed plan to increase [[Africa]]'s self-sufficiency.<ref name="uneca">{{cite web |url= http://www.uneca.org/itca/ariportal/docs/lagos_plan.pdf |title= Lagos Plan of Action for the Economic Development of Africa, 1980-2000 |accessdate= 2007-02-02 |date= April 1980 |work= |publisher= Organisation of African Unity, republished by the [[United Nations Economic Commission for Africa]] |pages= 104 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070106003042/http://uneca.org/itca/ariportal/docs/lagos_plan.PDF |archivedate= 2007-01-06 |df= }}</ref>
== History ==
It was drafted in [[Lagos]], [[Nigeria]] in April 1980, during a conference which included a variety of African leaders.<ref name="africaaction">{{cite web|url=http://www.africaaction.org/african-initiatives/aaf2.htm |title=What Africa Really Needs |accessdate=2007-02-02 |work=African Alternative Framework |publisher=[[Africa Action]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061120205806/http://www.africaaction.org/african-initiatives/aaf2.htm |archivedate=November 20, 2006 }}</ref> It has been characterized as the collective response of African states to the World Bank's 1981 [[Berg report]]. The plan blamed Africa's economic crisis on the [[Structural Adjustment Program]]s of the [[World Bank]] and [[International Monetary Fund]] and the vulnerability of African economies to worldwide economic shocks, such as the [[1973 oil crisis]].<ref name="Eyoh 1998, pp.281-306">Eyoh, Dickson - ''African Perspectives on Democracy and the Dilemmas of Postcolonial Intellectuals'' in African Affairs, Africa Today , 45(3-4), 1998, pp.281-306: p. 284</ref>
The report claimed that development in Africa could be achieved by a decreased reliance on raw material extraction, industrialization, global equality in trade relations and an increase in development aid from the international community. Africanist scholars noted the absence in the report of any blame on, or calls for reform of, domestic governments of Africa.<ref name="Eyoh 1998, pp.281-306"/> This contrasts significantly with the Berg Report, which apportioned blame solely on the Africa leaders themselves, with the international community taking no responsibility for their part in Africa's demise.
==See also== *[[Economy of Africa]] *[[Structural adjustment]] *[[Economic Development]]
==References== {{reflist}}

revision.comment: Bot: Removing [[Commons:File:LeontovychKap.JPEG]] ([[:File:LeontovychKap.JPEG|en]]). It was deleted on Commons by [[:Commons:User:~riley|~riley]] (Per [[Commons:Commons:Deletion requests/Files uploaded by Бандурист]]).
revision.text:
The '''Leontovych Bandurist Capella''' was a male choir whose members accompanied themselves using a Ukrainian folk instrument known as a [[bandura]]. It was established in the [[displaced persons camp]]s in [[Germany]] in 1946 and had an active performance schedule until 1949.
In 1946 [[Hryhory Nazarenko]] together with the [[Petro Honcharenko|Honcharenko]] brothers left the [[Ukrainian Bandurist Chorus]] and started working on establishing a new bandurist capella. This new capella was formed in the British zone in Germany in the city of [[Goslar]] and was called the Leontovych Bandurist Capella after the Ukrainian composer [[Mykola Leontovych]].
The Capella consisted of some 18 members taught and later directed by Hryhory Nazarenko. They played on diatonic [[Kharkiv-style]] [[bandura]]s with the newly developed mechanisms designed by the Honcharenko brothers. Nazarenko busied himself writing out arrangements and repertoire from the works performed by the [[Poltava Bandurist Capella]] teaching Kharkiv-style playing. He coached the choir and taught the members to play the bandura, including many of the technical devices developed by [[Hnat Khotkevych]].
Each of the members required instruments. The Honcharenko brothers set up a workshop in the DP camp where they were made and taught some of the members to make banduras.
The establishment of the Leontovych Capella was a very successful experiment. In the 1930s Nazarenko was the concertmaster of the Poltava and later [[Combined Bandurist Capella]]. In this capacity he also was in charge of the music library often writing on the orchestral parts for all the performers. Because of this, Nazarenko was able to restore from his own memory a number of works by [[Hnat Khotkevych]].
After successfully touring Germany with numerous concerts, many of the members joined up with the [[Ukrainian Bandurist Capella]] when they emigrated to the United States in 1949. Others migrated to [[England]], South America and Australia where they were able to share their knowledge with the Ukrainian communities established there.

{{incomplete list|date=November 2016}} This page provides lists of '''best-selling comic book series''' to date. It includes Japanese [[manga]], [[American comic book]]s, and [[European comics]]. The series are listed according to the highest sales estimates as reported in reliable sources. This list includes [[comic book]]s that have sold least 100{{nbsp}}million copies. There are three separate lists, for three different comic book publication formats ([[Trade paperback (comics)|collected comic book]] volumes, periodical [[Glossary of comics terminology#Comic book|floppy comic]] issues, and [[Comic anthology|comic magazines]]). == Collected comic book volumes == [[File:One Piece, Volume 1.jpg|thumb|Cover of ''One Piece'' Vol. 1 (1997). ''[[One Piece]]'' is the [[List of best-selling fiction authors|best-selling comic by a single author]] and the [[List of best-selling manga|best-selling manga]] of all time,http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2015/6/japanese-manga-%E2%80%9Cone-piece%E2%80%9D-is-most-printed-comic-series-by-one-author-ever-385868http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/118397-most-copies-published-by-a-single-author-for-the-same-comic-book-series having sold the most [[Tankōbon|collected comic book volumes]].]] This list is for comics printed in a traditional [[book]] format ([[paperback]] or [[hardcover]]), typically with a similar number of pages as [[novel]]s. The list includes [[graphic novel]]s printed exclusively in this format, and [[Trade paperback (comics)|trade paperback/hardcover]] books which compile periodical comic chapters/issues into larger collected volumes. This list includes Japanese manga [[tankōbon]] volumes, American [[Trade paperback (comics)|trade paperbacks]], [[graphic novel]]s, and European [[comic album]]s. These comic series were originally serialized either as chapters (typically 15-30 pages each) in comic publications (such as [[Comic anthology|comic magazines]]) or as single-page [[comic strip]]s in non-comic publications (such as newspapers), before being collected into a larger comic book volume (which compiles either multiple comic chapters or numerous comic strips). For comic series originally serialized as chapters in comic magazines or [[manga magazines]], their estimated circulation figures in those magazines are given in footnotes. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- " !Comic series !! ''[[Superman]]'' is the best-selling [[American comic book]] series, having sold the most periodical [[Glossary of comics terminology#Comic book|floppy comic]] issues.]] This list is for single-issue [[Glossary of comics terminology#Comic book|floppy comics]], also known as the [[American comic book]] format. Unlike the paperback book format, floppy comics are thinner [[periodicals]] and stapled together. Each floppy comic issue is typically 20-40 pages, and usually consists of a single chapter (as opposed to a larger comic book volume that typically includes multiple chapters). A floppy comic is comparable to a [[Comic anthology|comic magazine]], but is thinner in size and is dedicated to a single character or group of characters (whereas a comic magazine is thicker and serializes multiple different unrelated series). Floppy comics are the most common publication format for American comics. This list also contains periodical publications from other countries that are similarly dedicated to a single character or group of characters. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- " !Comic series !! {{Infobox company | name = Morison KSi | logo = MorisonKSi Logotype 1 RGB.jpg | type = Association of independent firms | location = Global Executive Office in [[London]] | founded = 1923 as Kingston Smith
1924 as Cabinet Sorel
1990 as Morison International and KS International | founders = Walter Morison, Herbert Kingston, Albert Sorel and George Alan Smith | industry = [[Accounting]]
[[Audit]]
[[professional services|Professional Services]]
[[Tax]]
[[Consultant|Consulting]] | revenue = USD$1.002 billion (2017)[https://www.accountingtoday.com/news/morison-merges-with-ksi-to-form-1-billion-international-firm-association Morison merges with KSi to form $1 billion international association] | homepage = [http://www.morisonksi.com www.morisonksi.com] }} '''Morison KSi''' (previously Morison International & KS International) is a global association of professional service firms (accounting, auditing, tax and business consulting). The association has 158 member firms in 88 countries.{{cite news|title=KSI, Morison merge|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20160220/business-news/KSI-Morison-merge.603070|accessdate=4 August 2017|publisher=Times of Malta|date=20 February 2016}} Morison KSi's status as an association is in accordance with the International Federation of Accountants (IFAC) audit code and the EU Statutory Audit Directive 2006/43/(EC) (“the 8th Directive”).[http://www.efaa.com/files/pdf/Audit/Directive%202006_43_EC.pdf EU Statutory Audit Directive 2006/43/(EC)] Morison KSi is ranked by the International Accounting Bulletin as the 9th largest accounting association in the world. In January 2017, the combined revenue of all member firms was USD1.002 billion. == Morison International == The association is the legacy of [[Walter Morison]] [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/military-obituaries/air-force-obituaries/5209332/Flight-Lieutenant-Walter-Morison.html Flight Lieutenant Walter Morison - The Telegraph, 2009] (26 November 1919 - 26 March 2009) a [[Royal Air Force]] pilot who became a prisoner of war and was sent to [[Colditz]] for attempting to steal an enemy aircraft during the Second World War. Following the war, Morison qualified as a chartered accountant at the [[Institute of Chartered Accountants in England & Wales]]. He was articled at Morison Stoneham, a firm established by his great uncle. Morison then worked at Coopers Bros, the firm that became [[Coopers & Lybrand]], before returning to his family firm, Morison Stoneham. He led the firm as a senior partner through a period of great change from 1960 to 1981 before retiring. Morison Stoneham was the founding firm of Morison International.[http://www.vrl-financial-news.com/accounting/intl-accounting-bulletin/issues/iab-2008/iab438/morison-international-appoints.aspx Morison International Appoints New Chief Executive - International Accounting Bulletin, October 2008] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130217002846/http://www.vrl-financial-news.com/accounting/intl-accounting-bulletin/issues/iab-2008/iab438/morison-international-appoints.aspx |date=2013-02-17 }} ==Corporate Governance== Morison KSi is run under the direction of an international Board with 5 sub-regional Boards - Africa, Asia Pacific, Europe, Latin America and North America. Liza Robbins is the CEO of Morison KSi. ==See also== *[[Accountancy]] *[[Financial audit|Audit]] *[[International Standards on Auditing]] *[[Russian club of financial directors]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.morisonksi.com Morison KSi] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20120212171340/http://www.vrl-financial-news.com/accounting/intl-accounting-bulletin.aspx International Accounting Bulletin] [[Category:Accounting firms]] [[Category:International business]]

{{see also|Index of Puerto Rico-related articles}} <!--... Attention: THIS IS AN OUTLINE
part of the set of 740+ outlines listed at [[Portal:Contents/Outlines]].
Wikipedia outlines are a special type of list article. They make up one of Wikipedia's content navigation systems
See [[Wikipedia:Outlines]] for more details. Further improvements to this outline are on the way ...--> {{double image|right|Flag of Puerto Rico.svg|200|Coat_of_arms_of_the_Commonwealth_of_Puerto_Rico.svg|100|The [[Flag of Puerto Rico]]|The [[Coat of Arms of Puerto Rico]]}} [[File:LocationPuertoRico.svg|thumb|306px|The location of [[Puerto Rico]]]] The following [[Outline (list)|outline]] is provided as an overview of and topical guide to [[Puerto Rico]]:
The '''[[Commonwealth of Puerto Rico]]''' is a [[Autonomy|self-governing]] [[Territories of the United States#Unincorporated organized territories|unincorporated territory]] of the [[United States of America]] located in the northeastern [[Caribbean]], east of the [[Dominican Republic]] and west of the [[Virgin Islands]].<ref name=CIA_World_Factbook>{{cite web|date=July 7, 2009|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/rq.html|title=Puerto Rico|work=[[The World Factbook]]|publisher=[[United States]] [[Central Intelligence Agency]]|accessdate=July 23, 2009}}</ref> The commonwealth comprises an [[archipelago]] that includes the main island of Puerto Rico and a number of smaller islands and [[Cay|keys]], the largest of which are [[Vieques, Puerto Rico|Vieques]], [[Culebra, Puerto Rico|Culebra]], and [[Mona, Puerto Rico|Mona]]. The main island of Puerto Rico is the least extensive but the third most populous of the four [[Greater Antilles]]: [[Cuba]], [[Hispaniola]], [[Jamaica]], and Puerto Rico.
[[Puerto Rican people|Puerto Ricans]] often call the island ''Borinquen'', from ''Borikén'', its [[Indigenous peoples|indigenous]] [[Taíno]] name.<ref>Allatson, Paul. Key Terms in Latino/a Cultural and Literary Studies, p. 47. Malden, Mass: Blackwell Publishing, 2007. {{ISBN|1-4051-0250-0}}. </ref><ref> [http://www.taino-tribe.org/terms1.htm#anchor250018 Dictionary: Taino Indigenous Peoples of the Caribbean] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071013032642/http://www.taino-tribe.org/terms1.htm |date=2007-10-13 }} Retrieved: February 21, 2008. (Based on the encyclopedia "Clásicos de Puerto Rico", 2nd. edition. Ed. Cayetano Coll y Toste. Publisher: Ediciones Latinoamericanas, S.A., 1972.). </ref> The terms ''boricua'' and ''borincano'' derive from ''Borikén'' and ''Borinquen'' respectively, and are commonly used to identify someone of Puerto Rican heritage. The island is also popularly known as "''La Isla del Encanto''", which translated means "The Island of Enchantment." {{TOC limit|limit=2}}{{clear}}
== General reference == [[File:PuertoRicoOMC.png|thumb|306px|An enlargeable map of the [[Commonwealth of Puerto Rico]]]] * [[International Phonetic Alphabet|Pronunciation]]: * Common English country name: [[Puerto Rico]] * Official English country name: The [[Commonwealth of Puerto Rico]] * Common [[endonym]](s): [[List of countries and capitals in native languages| ]] * Official endonym(s): [[List of official endonyms of present-day nations and states| ]] * [[List of adjectival and demonymic forms of place names#Countries and nations|Adjectival]](s): [[Puerto Rican people|Puerto Rican]] * [[List of adjectival and demonymic forms of place names#Countries and nations|Demonym]](s): * [[Etymology]]: [[Name of Puerto Rico]] * [[ISO country codes]]: PR, PRI, 630 * [[ISO region codes]]: See [[ISO 3166-2:PR]] * [[Internet]] [[country code top-level domain]]: [[.pr]] {{clear}}
== Geography of Puerto Rico == [[File:Puerto Rico-CIA WFB Map.png|thumb|An enlargeable basic map of [[Puerto Rico]]]] <!-- [[File:<Topographic Map>|thumb|An enlargeable topographic map of [[Puerto Rico]]]] -->
[[Geography of Puerto Rico]] * Puerto Rico is ** an [[archipelago|archipelagic]] [[island country]] ''(see also [[List of island countries]])'' ** a [[autonomy|self-governing]] [[Territories of the United States|unincorporated territory]] of the [[United States]] ** organized as a [[commonwealth]] * Location: ** [[Northern Hemisphere]] and [[Western Hemisphere]] *** [[North America]] (though not on the [[mainland]]) ** [[Atlantic Ocean]] *** [[North Atlantic]] **** [[Caribbean]] ***** [[Antilles]] ****** [[Greater Antilles]] ** [[Time zone]]: [[Eastern Caribbean Time]] ([[UTC-04]]) ** Extreme points of Puerto Rico *** High: [[Cerro de Punta]] {{convert|1338|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} *** Low: [[Caribbean Sea]] 0 m ** Land boundaries: ''none'' ** Coastline: 501 km * [[Population of Puerto Rico]]: 3,991,000 – [[List of U.S. states and territories by population|26th most populous US jurisdiction]] * [[Area of Puerto Rico]]: 9,104 km<sup>2</sup> * [[:commons:Atlas of Puerto Rico|Atlas of Puerto Rico]]

{{Infobox company |name = SES Platform Services GmbH |logo = [[Image:SES Platform Services logo.png|200px|200px]] |type = Privately owned subsidiary |foundation = 2004 |location = [[Unterföhring]], [[Germany]] |key_people = Wilfried Urner (CEO) |num_employees = |industry = [[Telecommunications]]
[[Digital media]] services to the [[broadcast]] industry |slogan = |products = Satellite and broadcasting services |revenue = |operating_income = |net_income = |homepage = www.ses-ps.com | }} '''SES Platform Services GmbH''' (previously ASTRA Platform Services GmbH, now [[MX1 Ltd|MX1]]) is a subsidiary company of [[SES S.A.|SES]] (owner and operator of the [[Astra (satellites)|Astra]] satellites) based in [[Betzdorf, Luxembourg]] . From its headquarters in [[Unterföhring]] near [[Munich, Germany]], SES Platform Services operates a broadcasting centre, providing a wide range of services, including content management, [[playout]], [[encryption]], [[multiplexing]], [[uplink|satellite uplinks]] and other [[digital TV]] media broadcast services for the [[broadcast industry]]. Following completion of the acquisition by SES Platform Services of global digital media services provider [[RR Media]] in July 2016, the name of the merged company was changed to [[MX1 Ltd|MX1]]{{cite press release |publisher=SES |date=July 6, 2016 |url= http://www.ses.com/4233325/news/2016/22329451|title=SES ANNOUNCES SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF MERGER OF RR MEDIA WITH SES PLATFORM SERVICES|accessdate = July 26, 2016}} Before changing to MX1, SES Platform Services distributed more than 300 digital TV channels (including [[High-definition television|HD]])and radio stations, interactive services and data services.{{cite press release |publisher=SES Platform Services GmbH |date=July 1, 2013 |url=http://www.ses-ps.com/15564899/01-07-13-sky_go|title=SES Platform Services takes charge of multiscreen encoding for Sky Go | accessdate = August 31, 2013}} In August 2013, SES Platform Services won an international tender by [[Turner Broadcasting System]], starting November 2013, to provide playout for the broadcast channels, [[Boomerang (TV channel)|Boomerang]], [[Cartoon Network (Germany)|Cartoon Network]], [[Glitz* (Germany)|glitz*]], [[RT (TV network)|RT]], [[TNT Film]] and [[TNT Serie]] (in both SD and HD) for the German-speaking market, digitization of existing Turner content, and playout for Turner [[Video on demand|on-demand]] and [[Internet television|catch-up]] services in Germany, Austria, Switzerland the Benelux region.{{cite press release |publisher=SES Platform Services GmbH |date=August 28, 2013 |url=http://www.ses-ps.com/15889196/30-08-2013-Turner |title=SES Platform Services wins international tender by Turner Broadcasting |accessdate=August 31, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130902173713/http://www.ses-ps.com/15889196/30-08-2013-Turner |archivedate=September 2, 2013 |df= }} ==History== Originally called DPC (Digital Playout Centre GmbH), SES Platform Services was founded in 1996 by Kirch, a German media company. The German Pay TV provider, Premiere (now [[Sky Deutschland]]) was part of the Kirch group and DPC provided (and, as SES Platform Services, continues to provide) Premiere/Sky Deutschland, as well as other private and public German broadcasters, playout, multiplexing, encrypted satellite uplinks and other media broadcast services. In June 2004, SES announced that it had bought the controlling interest in DPC from Premiere with the intention of launching an "open" pay-TV platform for Germany using Premiere-compatible digital set top boxes.{{cite press release |publisher=SES Astra |date=June 28, 2004 |url= http://www.ses.com/4233325/news/2004/4441809 |title=SES ASTRA acquires 75.2% stake in DPC (Digital Playout Center) from PREMIERE| accessdate = January 26, 2012}} [[Image:AstraPlatformServicesLogo.jpg|120px|right|The pre-2012 logo for the company before the change of name to SES Platform Services]] In December 2004, a requirement for regulatory approval from the German Federal Cartels Office ([[Bundeskartellamt]]) meant that the deal was changed to 100% of DPC, to give SES sole ownership.{{cite press release |publisher=SES Astra |date=January 4, 2005 |url= http://www.ses.com/4233325/news/2005/4413219|title= SES ASTRA completes acquisition of 100% of DPC digital playout center GmbH | accessdate = January 26, 2012}} DPC was later renamed to ASTRA Platform Services GmbH (APS), and in April 2012 to SES Platform Services. In February 2016, it was announced that SES Platform Services had agreed, subject to regulatory approvals, to purchase [[RR Media]], a global digital media services provider to the broadcast and media industries, based in Israel.{{cite press release |publisher=RR Media |date=February 26, 2016 |url= http://www.rrmedia.com/pages/latest-news---february-26-2016|title=RR Media to Merge with SES Platform Services|accessdate = February 26, 2016}} ==Services== [[File:Parabolic antennas Astra Platform Services Unterföhring DE 2010-06-09.jpg|thumb|SES Platform Services [[uplink]] dishes in [[Unterföhring]]]] The main services provided to broadcasters by SES Platform Services are Content Management, Playout, Encryption, Distribution and Interactive services. Customers include Sky Deutschland and [[ProSiebenSat.1]] in Germany, Top TV in South Africa, channels such as Home Shopping Europe, [[Deutsches Sportfernsehen|DSF]], [[Tele 5]], [[9Live]], and [[DMAX (TV channel)|DMAX]], and most German [[HDTV]] channels, including those from Discovery, and Anixe. SES Platform Services' content management encompasses digitization of tape-based content, format conversion of video files, quality control, tape storage (now being superseded by digital storage), and a growing digital archive service with integrated digital asset management systems.{{cite press release |publisher=SES |date=April 8, 2011 |url=http://www.ses.com/4233325/news/2011/4493190|title=ASTRA PLATFORM SERVICES OPENS NEW PLAYOUT CENTRE | accessdate = January 26, 2012}} SES Platform Services uses the DIVArchive digital archiving system from Front Porch Digital with (as of mid 2009), over 1 PB capacity storing tens of thousands of hours of content. New material is added at the rate of about 1000–2000 hours per month. Although SES Platform Services still provides videotape storage, this has reduced by more than half since digital archiving was introduced.FP Digital [http://www.fpdigital.com/Products/CaseStudies/APS_casestudy_letter.pdf ''Case Study: Astra Platform Services GmbH'']. Company factsheet. Retrieved July 30, 2009 SES Platform Services undertakes the preparation and playout of content from tape or digital files according to the customer's supplied schedule. SES Platform Services provides customers with visual quality control, the incorporation of on-screen branding and graphics (in 2D or 3D), [[EPG]] data and expandable services that range from automatic small channel start-up systems to high-end systems with full-time monitoring and support. Where needed, interactive services can also be provided to broadcasters, including HbbTV (Hybrid Broadcast Broadband TV). SES Platform Services also designs and develops broadcasters’ web pages, and has developed the Blucom interactive TV-service that combines broadcasting and mobile technologies to offer services such as programme announcements, weather, lottery and sports results, and further programme information. Blucom enables interaction such as voting, downloads, chats, and advertising. It also gives mobile phones the ability to stream live TV broadcasts. Blucom synchronizes TV content with the additional information in real-time. Content is sent to a set-top box via satellite, then to a mobile phone via Bluetooth, or directly to the mobile phone via [[UMTS]]/[[GPRS]]. The return channel operates from the viewer’s mobile via [[SMS]] or UMTS/GPRS. For pay-TV broadcasts, SES Platform Services provides channel encryption for subscription and pay-per-view protection with [[Conax]], [[Cryptoworks]], Irdeto, [[Nagravision]], and [[NDS Group|NDS]] [[conditional access]] systems using [[Digital Video Broadcasting|DVB]] simulcrypt operation for broadcasts using multiple conditional access systems in parallel, this being a common practice in "free-to-air"(FTA) satellite TV broadcast markets such as Germany. SES Platform Services also provides Microsoft or Flash digital rights management for Internet streamed channels. Although the majority of SES Platform Services broadcasting traffic is digital television channels in SD or HD uplinked to the Astra satellites, SES Platform Services can also distribute programming to mobiles as on-demand content, and as live or on-demand video over the Internet using Windows Media Player, QuickTime or Flash. In April 2011, SES Platform Services opened a new playout centre at its headquarters in Unterföhring to handle expansion of the company, and its client list. The new network operations centre is in a purpose-built new building with the latest technologies including air conditioning based on groundwater cooling, fully redundant power distribution system, and LED screens and LED room lighting in the master control room to minimise heat generation. The old premises are being retained as back-up facilities and the new centre is expected to cope with growth for the next five years.''SES Expands On The Ground'' TVB Europe June 2011 pp11 In June 2015 SES Platform Services launched its Fluid Hub managed cloud service for management, playout and distribution of video content for studios, content creators, broadcasting companies, telcos/platforms and other customers. By October 20, the service had 10 customers including Fox International Channels Germany and Turner.{{cite press release |publisher=SES |date=October 10, 2015|url=http://www.ses.com/4233325/news/2015/21629284|title=SES PLATFORM SERVICES’ FLUID HUB PASSES 10-CUSTOMER MILESTONE| accessdate = October 29, 2015}} ==See also== *[[MX1 Ltd|MX1]] *[[Digital television in Germany]] *[[Satellite television]] *[[SES S.A.|SES]] *[[Astra (satellites)|Astra]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ses-ps.com SES Platform Services website] **[http://www.mx1.com MX1 website] *[http://www.onastra.com OnAstra] - Official Astra consumers/viewers' site *[http://www.ses.com/ SES] - Official SES trade/industry site [[Category:SES]] [[Category:Satellite television]] [[Category:Interactive television]] [[Category:Satellite operators]]

revision.text:
'''Solimana''' was a minor [[West Africa]]n state of the nineteenth century with a capital at the fortress town of [[Falaba]]. Situated on rich [[African slave trade|slave-trading]] routes in what is now [[Sierra Leone]], Solimana was visited in 1822 by [[Alexander Gordon Laing]] and in 1869 by [[William Winwood Reade]], making it nominally [[United Kingdom|British]].
In 1884, [[Mandinka people|Mandinka]] conqueror [[Samori]] joined the king of [[Kaliere]] in attacking Solimana, then under the rule of [[Manga Sewa]]. After Samori's general [[N'fa Ali]] destroyed a number of surrounding villages, the Mandinka forces began a five-month siege of Falaba itself. With the city's residents starved nearly to death, Manga Sewa gathered his family in Falaba's [[gunpowder]] magazine and lit a torch, simultaneously killing himself and breaching Falaba's walls.
The territory of Solimana was then briefly assimilated into Samori's [[Wassoulou Empire]]. Following Samori's own fall several years later, it was claimed by the British and incorporated into the [[Sierra Leone Colony and Protectorate|Crown Colony of Sierra Leone]].
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060222005607/http://www.sierra-leone.org/heroes4.html Brief biography of Manga Sewa]
{{coord missing|Sierra Leone}}
[[Category:History of Sierra Leone]] [[Category:Former countries in Africa]] [[Category:States and territories disestablished in 1884]] [[Category:19th century in Africa]]

revision.text:
{{Unreferenced|date=September 2010}} {{infobox book | | name = The Dark Volume | title_orig = | translator = | image = | caption = | author = [[GW Dahlquist]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | series = | genre = [[Novel]]
[[Steampunk]] | publisher = Viking | release_date = 2007 | english_release_date = | media_type = Print ([[Hardcover|Hardback]], and [[Paperback]]) | pages = 516pp | isbn = | preceded_by = [[The Glass Books of the Dream Eaters]] | followed_by = [[The Chemickal Marriage]] }} '''''The Dark Volume''''' is a novel in the [[Steampunk]] genre by [[GW Dahlquist]]. It is his second novel after 2006's [[The Glass Books of the Dream Eaters]]. ==Synopsis== The novel follows the ongoing adventures of the three protagonists of ''[[The Glass Books of the Dream Eaters]]'' and is set in what appears to be an alternative Victorian past in a series of alternative Baltic or Teutonic states. The story began as a sequel to Dahlquist's earlier, complex fantasy novel, but eventually develops into a much larger work. ==Characters in ''The Dark Volume''== ===Major characters=== The action revolves around three protagonists. Celeste Temple, Cardinal Chang and Dr Svenson who represent three aspects of iconic Victorian characterization. Celeste Temple represents the archetypal headstrong young Victorian heroine. Cardinal Chang represents the violent underclass in 19th century society, but whose character is tempered and enriched by a private and introspective love of poetry. Svenson, a military surgeon represent superior intellect and moral development constrained by a bond of duty for an aristocratic master who fails to be worth of his respect. The main action in the Dark Volume revolves around these three characters personal interactions and their attempts to achieve their differing goals while protecting each other persons. ==References== * http://www.guardian.co.uk/books/2008/jun/28/saturdayreviewsfeatres.guardianreview14 ==External links== {{DEFAULTSORT:Dark Volume}} [[Category:2007 British novels]] [[Category:Novels first published in serial form]] [[Category:English novels]] [[Category:Steampunk novels]] {{Europe-novel-stub}} {{2000s-sf-novel-stub}}
